creator: carnold@houston.rr.com
text:
It appears that getElementsByTagName("foo") is implemented 
as if it were getElementsByTagName(null,"foo").

getElementsByTagName() is supposed to be totally namespace
unaware and match both [foo] elements in the following sample.

[bar]
   [foo/]
   [foo xmlns="http://www.example.org/foobar"/]
[/bar]

Where getElementsByTagNameNS(null,"foo") should only match the first.

All that should be needed is to pass in a comparison object
into AbstractParentNode.ElementsByTagName instead of an namespace URI
and local name.
